content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I accept this contribution because it's a fast and fun challenge

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good puzzle.
The statement is very clear and the problem can be resolved quickly.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is generally a quick and easy solution. It's a new variation on an old programming example (half-factorials instead of factorials) so it gives users a new experience while not being overly complicated.

The description is clear and easy to understand, even if a user doesn't know what a half-factorial is. 

Testing through Java and C, it works perfectly.

Goal
* Please format the unformatted "n" as a [[variable]] (twice).

* In the second paragraph, please change "odd numbers" to "positive odd numbers".

Output
* Please format "n" as a [[variable]].

Cases
* Test 5 and Validator 5 are the same. Please change them so that they are different. Preferably Validator 5 continues to have an even number as the input.

Thanks.
